title: Systems Engineer II - Red Sea Airport (ICT, Airport Systems)
description: design solutions to drive safe living and quality of life the future is what we make it. when you join honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. that means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on mars. working at honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. that’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. we don’t just sell things. we offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges. key responsibilities: understand the specification compliance and scope responsibilities. budget analysis. engineering performance and progress reporting. lead the identification, development, deployment of commissioning engineering processes, procedures, and tools to drive commissioning excellence, standardization, and continuous improvement. work with sme teams to deliver the most suitable solutions proactively work with risk assessment and mitigation plan system design and engineering. value engineering and material/ cost savings. vo estimation and cost analysis. coordination with remote engineering team. deliver the project within the project schedule with positive deviation job assignment and teamwork. schedule and milestone development. understand technology. junior / cx engineer team management. develop and maintain the excellent customer relations. we value: bachelor’s degree in any related field (electrical engineer/ computer engineer/airport engineer). min 5+ years of experience in the field. experience in understanding of specs compliance project requirements. experience with ict networks and special airport systems. experience in ict network architecture and airport operator requirement and interfaces. experience in airport data network and special airport systems design requirement. experience in airport codes and standards. certification required such as (iata-icao). experience in configuring the servers and front-end software and commissioning. knowledge in review the shop drawings. we offer: the opportunity to work on the world’s most exciting projects, transforming the cities we live in, the buildings where we work, and the vehicles that move us. group medical insurance plan life. paid annual leave and time off work. a culture that fosters inclusion, diversity and innovation. market specific training and on-going personal development. if this is your dream role, then we'd love to hear from you. we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. we will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. please contact us to request accommodation. additional information job id: req437658 category: engineering location: zakri building, al-zakhir industrial area,hon.turki arabia ltd.,yanbu,al madinah,saudi arabia exempt

name: Parsons
title: Lead Treatment Specialist (Water/Wastewater)
description: job description: parsons is looking for an amazingly talented lead treatment specialist to join our team! water wastewater engineer job description: a water wastewater engineer is responsible for designing, planning, and design review of projects related to water and wastewater treatment systems. they work in collaboration with a team of engineers and technicians to ensure the efficient and effective operation of water and wastewater treatment facilities. this role requires technical expertise in engineering principles, environmental regulations, and project management. water wastewater engineer responsibilities: process engineering design development based on parsons design guidelines and good engineering practice, providing cost-effective solutions whilst ensuring technical compliance with client requirements. design and develop water and wastewater treatment systems, including the selection and sizing of equipment, calculations, and hydraulic modeling. conduct engineering evaluations and cost studies for water and wastewater projects, analyzing data and identifying potential issues or improvements. prepare detailed engineering plans, specifications, and cost estimates for water and wastewater infrastructure projects. collaborate with clients, regulatory agencies, and other stakeholders to ensure compliance with environmental regulations and permit requirements. represent the company during technical meetings with potential customers, vendors, and subcontractors. research and stay updated on emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in water and wastewater engineering. provide technical support and guidance to junior engineers and technicians, fostering a collaborative and learning environment. develop and maintain project documentation, including reports, drawings, and specifications. water wastewater engineer required skills: strong knowledge of water and wastewater treatment processes, including physical, chemical, and biological treatment methods. proficiency in using engineering software and tools, such as autocad, hydraulic modeling software, and data analysis tools. excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex engineering issues. effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and engage with clients and stakeholders. knowledge of environmental regulations and permit requirements in relation to water and wastewater treatment facilities. attention to detail and accuracy in design calculations, cost estimates, and technical documentation. ability to adapt to changing priorities and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. strong organizational skills, with the ability to maintain project documentation and records systematically. commitment to continuous learning and professional development in the field of water and wastewater engineering. required qualifications bachelor’s degree in civil, environmental, or chemical engineering. a master's degree is preferred. minimum of 15 years of experience in water and wastewater engineering, preferably in the design and construction of treatment systems. proficiency in engineering software, such as autocad, hydraulic modeling software, and data analysis tools. familiarity with environmental regulations and permit requirements related to water and wastewater treatment facilities. strong project management skills, with a demonstrated track record of successfully managing and delivering engineering projects. excellent written and verbal communication skills. ability to work independently as well as part of a team. willingness to travel to project sites and participate in site inspections and meetings as required. commitment to health and safety practices in the workplace. minimum clearance required to start: not applicable/none parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. minority/female/disabled/protected veteran.

name: AtkinsRéalis
title: Graphic Specialist - AlUla
description: atkinsréalis is a world-leading design, engineering and project management organization. we connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. together, with our industry partners and clients, and our global team of consultants, designers, engineers and project managers, we can change the world. we have a strong presence in the middle east that enables us to build deep and lasting relationships with our clients. we share their goals and long-term ambitions; we’re on the same journey to create places and infrastructure which will support long term sustainable development, healthy living and vibrant communities. we are seeking for a graphic specialist to form part of our project team, based in al ula, saudi arabia. responsibilities produce high quality reports and other documentation for external use and publication. production of high quality graphics in the forms of maps, plans and illustrations within illustrator, photoshop and autocad for use within bids and formal submissions. to work on a number of individual projects concurrently and prioritize effectively to meet deadlines. adherence to atkins bms and procedures. to work as part of an integrated building design team and co-ordinate with other design disciplines. technical competencies essential: diploma/degree in appropriate area. significant expertise and experience in a number of mainstream graphics packages, including in design, photoshop, illustrator and sketch up. ability to use autocad to a high standard is also essential. must have a minimum of 5 years experience ideally within a multidisciplinary consultancy environment. must be able to produce high quality, creative and attractive reports and other such documentation within indesign. must be able to produce high quality graphics in the forms of maps, plans and illustrations within illustrator, photoshop and autocad. ability for self checking & correction of work. must have appreciation of the work of other disciplines. must be able to communicate in english effectively, both written and verbal. must be able to learn and retain new skills quickly from a variety of sources. desirable : knowledge of sketchup, revit and other related software packages. exposure to multidisciplinary consultancy environment within gcc region. ability to travel without restriction throughout the gcc region. behavioral competencies ability to work as part of a team. able to use own initiative and work without excessive supervision. able to prioritize, plan workload efficiently, and meet deadlines. attention to detail – able to self check and correct work. creativity, originality and imagination in the production high quality reports, graphics and other material.

name: AtkinsRéalis
title: Risk Manager
description: join us in engineering a better future for our planet and its people. atkinsréalis is a world-leading design, engineering and project management organization. we connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. together, with our industry partners and clients, and our global team of consultants, designers, engineers and project managers, we can change the world. we have a strong presence in the middle east that enables us to build deep and lasting relationships with our clients. we share their goals and long-term ambitions; we’re on the same journey to create places and infrastructure which will support long term sustainable development, healthy living and vibrant communities. we are seeking a risk manager to form part of our project management consultant (pmc) project team, based in al ula, saudi arabia. job description develop and monitor a risk issue and opportunity management process. develop and maintain a risk matrix identifying dependencies and the impacts of not meeting scheduled dates. identify, monitor and managing dependencies, and for resolving related issues. identify opportunities to arrange and co-ordinate any necessary discussions and agreements to realize benefits. monitor projects and ensure that an adequate and robust risk management process is under active management. implement risk management plan, risk log, and associated governance process. track significant risks to ensure that they are being systematically identified, recorded, evaluated, actively managed and regularly re-evaluated, and communicated across the program. identify, communicate, and manage inter-program or external risks. identify and manage internal program-related risks. review and update risk log against program status reports & meetings requirements qualifications graduate in engineering / business or equivalent postgraduate qualifications or equivalent risk management qualification or equivalent would be preferred. essential criteria understanding and experience of complex projects strong leadership, communication, and management skills track record of risk management responsibilities in addition, the client wishes to achieve the following objectives: provide accurate and timely management information on a regular basis on the status of various projects to monitor progress and drive delivery of individual projects, challenging and accelerating these where appropriate to enable management of risks and opportunities at the programme level to drive commonality and coherence between the various projects to ensure the interdependencies between various projects is understood and managed to ensure appropriate standards are set and adhered to legally and commercially to ensure the client is obtaining value for money through negotiations with suppliers develop the capacity of the client through the transfer of knowledge, skills and abilities o implement best practice program, project and other management and administrative processes

name: Parsons
title: Principal Engineer (Corrosion Control)
description: job description: parsons is looking for an amazingly talented principal engineer (corrosion control) to join our team! in this role you will get to lead the development and implementation of effective corrosion control strategies across our operations. this position plays a critical role in protecting assets, ensuring regulatory compliance, and minimizing risks associated with corrosion. reports directly to the manager of the engineering department and requires regular interaction with representatives from a variety of functional groups including other departments within technical affairs division, and other internal or external stakeholders as required. what you'll be doing: develop and implement comprehensive corrosion control programs for various assets, including pipelines, facilities, and infrastructure. conduct corrosion risk assessments, surveys, and inspections to identify potential problems and recommend mitigation strategies. stay updated on the latest advancements in corrosion control technologies and materials, and evaluate their applicability to our operations. design and oversee the installation of corrosion control systems, including cathodic protection, coatings, and inhibitors. monitor and analyze corrosion data to assess the effectiveness of control measures and identify areas for improvement. collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, operations, and maintenance, to ensure consistent implementation of corrosion control practices. develop and deliver technical presentations and training programs on corrosion control to colleagues and stakeholders. prepare and manage budgets for corrosion control activities. maintain accurate and complete records of corrosion control activities and data. identify and implement opportunities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of corrosion control programs. participate in the development and implementation of company-wide corrosion control policies and procedures. represent the company on corrosion-related committees and industry forums. what required skills you'll bring: bachelor's degree in chemical engineering, materials science, or a related field. minimum of 10 years of experience in industrial corrosion control, with a proven track record of success. in-depth knowledge of corrosion mechanisms, materials selection, and mitigation strategies. experience with various corrosion control technologies, including coatings, cathodic protection, and corrosion inhibitors. strong analytical and problem-solving skills. excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills. ability to work independently and as part of a team. proficient in ms office suite and engineering software (e.g., autocad, nace dataview). familiarity with relevant industry standards and regulations (e.g., nace, api). minimum clearance required to start: not applicable/none parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. minority/female/disabled/protected veteran.

name: JASARA PMC
title: Technical Writer Manager
description: working under the direction of the xcs quality assurance director, the technical writing manager will develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards. the technical writing manager will need to gain a deep understanding of assurance products and services, and translate complex information into simple, polished, engaging content. the technical writing manager will develop and maintain detailed data bases of reference materials, including research, and design specifications. the technical writing manager will provide direction and support in the development of qiddiya assurance communication material and organizational improvements to the xcs assurance functional areas of quality, health, safety and welfare, and environment and sustainability and xds project delivery teams. specific responsibilities: research, outline, write, and edit content, working closely with various departments to understand project requirements gather information from subject-matter experts and develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation work with development and support leads to identify documentation repositories, revise and edit, and determine best solutions for data compilation and centralized storage research, create, and maintain information architecture templates that adhere to organizational and legal standards and allow for easy data migration develop content in alternative media forms for maximum usability, with consistent voice across all documentation requirements 4-year degree in journalism, communications, or relevant technical field and minimum of 8 years of related work experience in construction or similar field, including managerial experience. requires knowledge of organizational practices, processes, and current technology. business management experience with knowledge of health, safety and environment management preferred. required skills and qualifications eight or more years of experience as an effective technical writer proven ability to quickly learn and understand complex subject matter experience in writing documentation and procedure manuals for various audiences superb written communication skills, with a keen eye for detail experience in working with engineers to improve user experience (ex: design, ui), refine content, and create visuals and diagrams for technical support content ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously preferred skills and qualifications bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in journalism, communications, or relevant technical field firm understanding of sdlc (systems development lifecycle) previous experience in hseq procedure development professional certification (ex: society for technical communication) experience in using xml tools to create documentation

name: Hitachi Energy
title: Procurement Team Leader
description: you as a procurement team leader will be part of hitachi energy high voltage business based in dammam, saudi arabia. you will be leading a functional work team of buyers, procurement specialists and/or analysts to deliver accurate and timely procurement activities like transactional purchasing, e-sourcing, data management and reporting. ensuring execution in accordance with company and procurement and logistics (pl) instructions and procedures. your responsibilities managing execution and tracking of procurement activities within the team, while ensuring quality of delivery service at improved transactional cost. ensuring buyers minimize risk regarding quality and financial exposure by buying in accordance with quality and commercial procedures and in accordance with company guidelines. ensuring the accurate application of group pl guidelines and local standard operating procedures (sops) to drive improvement in cost, quality, delivery and working capital (payment terms, lead times, order quantities and purchased material inventory). proposing improvements to standard operating procedures wherever opportunities for optimization are detected. coaching and mentoring the functional work team. ensuring that the team has appropriate skills and competencies to coordinate the pl activities. executing the implementation, operation, maintenance, and performance of supply chain systems within the gbs procurement center. securing full utilization of pro-supply global supplier relationship management platform according to relevant procedure, both related to sharing of supplier information and to finding existing high performing suppliers to hitachi energy. investigating problems, finding root causes, and recommending improvement to existing and planned pl processes. ensuring (with hr manager support) that the area of responsibility is properly organized, staffed, skilled and directed. guiding, motivating and developing direct and indirect subordinates within hr policies and group procurement and logistics excellence guidelines (knowledge management, functional training, etc.). responsible for coordinating pl talent management and succession planning within assigned area. living hitachi energy’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business. your background a bachelor’s degree in electrical/mechanical engineer. minimum of 10+ years of experience in managing procurement activities in power/energy/manufacturing industry. hands on experience in managing large teams. proven knowledge in p2p process and system. hands on experience in sap/mm module. experience in ms office suite. proficiency in both spoken & written english and arabic language is required. basic info location dammam, eastern region, saudi arabia job type full time experience management job function supply chain contract regular publication date 2024-03-07 reference number r0043646

name: Parsons
title: Senior QA/QC Engineer
description: job description: parsons is looking for an amazingly talented senior qa/qc engineer to join our team! in this role you will get to provide review and direct within engineering department (ed) on quality to ensure that quality requirements of the design and revision activities have been fulfilled. should be expert in spearheaded in the restructuring and management of the quality management system (qms) plan, where quality assurance and control procedures and fundamentals are detailed . what you'll be doing: acts as a senior engineer, with overall coordination of quality and development of business process, along with business requirements documents, within ed. working with sections in developing dashboards to address quality and reviewing quality procedures in scheduling, reporting and business processes adhering to unified procedures. establishes the program implementation requirements, for all areas of the department, and monitors the draft and final deliverables for adherence to those criteria. oversees establishments of engineering department quality assurance / quality control plan, and other documents as required. recommends and verifies effective implementation of corrective action to quality issues, in coordination with section, department management and other stakeholders. coordinates with management for interface on quality activities with internal and external stakeholders. monitor and report to management on the progress of all quality activities within the department, including significant milestones and any conditions which would affect quality or schedule. review of final submittals for contracts documents delivered by consultants. coordinate with contract department for reviews and insure the quality of all contracts documents necessary for bidding. perform other responsibilities associate with this position as may be appropriate. what required skills you'll bring: preparation of the quality plan and establishment of the quality system. timely and high-quality reporting by collating required information and inputs from the technical teams, incorporating schedule data, and finalizing the reports to achieve delivery of the project as per the quality plan prepared. act as a single point of contact for technical and qa/qc issues. manage the engineering issues taking into account integration across all disciplines. manage final contract documents deliverables and ensure that deliverables are reviewed and accepted within defined procedure. monitor the contract activities in line with schedule and take action/inform unit supervisor in case of delays. avoiding repetitive assignments to the project teams. education/qualifications require: bachelor's degree in appropriate discipline related field to the work from recognized university. minimum eight (8) years' experience in engineering design with demonstrated training in the application of quality. control and quality assurance systems and procedures. strong verbal, written, and organizational skills. minimum clearance required to start: not applicable/none parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. minority/female/disabled/protected veteran.

name: Parsons
title: Senior Engineer (Electrical)
description: job description: parsons is looking for an amazingly talented senior electrical engineer to join our team! in this role you will get to provide projects and design management support to the principal project engineer what you'll be doing: develops the scope of work for design tasks in coordination with the technical support section (tss) and stakeholders. coordinates for review, preparation and issuance of task orders including review of a/es technical and commercial proposals manages overall design from concept, design development and construction documents. works closely with the a/es and reviewers, provide necessary coordination for data acquisition, and 3rd party reviews. conducts design review meetings. assists in coordinating the compilation of technical portions of requests for proposal (rfp) for both the design and construction portions of assigned projects. analyzes data pertaining to client requirements to assist in the definition of technical aspects of detailed scope of work. coordinates with technical support section (tss) for the development of design specifications, and ensures adequate information is provided for clarity of interpretation of required scope of work. participate in the technical evaluation of potential bidders for contracts on assigned projects, and in recommending shortlists of qualified contractors. coordinates the technical analysis and evaluation of bids proposed. assist in compiling technical portions of definitive contracts. monitors technical progress of a/e contractor. coordinates the review of design drawings, specifications, manuals, shop drawings, vendor data, calculations and other technical information submitted by the a/e contractor for all phases of contract. provides requested technical information to a/e or construction contractor regarding interpretation of specifications, and other technical guidance as required. requests technical information or clarification of submitted data from a/e construction contractor as required. prepares report and presentations on assigned projects. coordinate with project management department progress reporting and evaluation for the assigned projects provide input to the rc authorized representative in review of quarterly performance evaluation for the a/e. provide technical support during pre-award stage including but not limited to bidders q&as, addendums, bid evaluation, release of final ifc drawings etc. provide post-award support during construction functions as a technical expert in performing analysis in specialized area. reviews problem areas, recommends solutions, alternatives and improvements. conducts reviews on technical provisions of work and prepares special technical reports. prepares interface layouts and conflicts solutions. prepares technical correspondence, reports, and studies. perform field inspections and provide field support. assist in the preparation master planning in the creation of capital improvement projects and verifying the capacity of existing utility systems and establishing new ones. what required skills you'll bring: refer to job description for education and experience requirements candidate should have bachelor degree in electrical engineering. professional registration as an engineer preferred or, at least, be working towards achieving this. 8 years of directly related experience to the position specifically in project management of electrical design work activities. extensive knowledge of design and installation of electrical systems, low and mid voltages. pmp certificate beneficial, but not mandatory strong familiarity with the engineering design processes as well as construction and project management. adequate knowledge of multiple engineering disciplines. experience with overseeing planning and design of infrastructure and facilities. comprehensive knowledge of the principles and practices of engineering as related to the preparation of plans and specifications. knowledge of methods and techniques utilized in the design and construction of public works and utility projects strong background of electrical project management and supervisory assignments in scheduling, project acceptance, planning, budgeting, procurement and feasibility studies. candidate should have excellency ability to read, analyze and communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing english language. proven ability to perform project management role through knowledge of industry practices and regulation. must be fully aware of the current industry technology. ability to proficiently perform duties in accordance with the job description for the electrical engineer role. minimum clearance required to start: not applicable/none parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. minority/female/disabled/protected veteran.

name: Digital Grid
title: Enterprise Architect
description: job description summary job description ge digital grid software partners with electric grid utilities to deliver mission critical monitoring, analysis, and control system software worldwide and is seeking an enterprise solution architect that will serve as a chief technologist advisor to our prospects and customers. seeking stellar interpersonal communicator ready to help our prospects and customers understand our robust power system management offerings. responsible for external facing consultation on highly complex software opportunities that require in-depth domain knowledge or two or more specialized architecture areas. pursues activities and processes that help the sales organization achieve business objectives. high levels of commercial judgment are required to achieve outcomes required. requires specialized knowledge in t&d product lines, markets, sales processes, and customer groups. requires strong commercial awareness and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory. at the enterprise solution architect you will work with business stakeholders, technology leadership, and other architects to drive holistic technology implementation across value streams (i.e., a sets products, solutions, and services that deliver value to the customer) and enablers (i.e., the activities needed to provide future business functionality, including infrastructure, security, and compliance activities). you will rely on continuous feedback that fosters adaptive design and engineering practices, and drives collaboration between programs and teams around a common vision across each architectural domain (functional, application, data, infrastructure). you will develops end-to-end architecture approach, including strategy and vision, guiding principles, and standards, incorporating technology trends and business imperatives into the future state design. you will ensure that common architecture decisions are implemented consistently in order to support the business, ot and it strategy. guides solution and domain architects across the organization on industry-leading practices, ensuring solutions align with enterprise architecture standards. this role will: lead and coordinate the domain technical and business discussions relative to future architecture direction across the gridos product portfolio or product lines including ecosystem. engage with functional c-suite and senior leaders in both it and ot analyze design and develop a roadmap and implementation plan based upon a current vs. future state in a cohesive architecture viewpoint. review and/or analyze and develop architectural requirements at domain level within product portfolio or team. participate in the enterprise architecture domain governance model. contribute to the development of software and data delivery platforms with reusable components that can be orchestrated together into different methods. lead the research and evaluation of emerging technology, industry, and market trends to assist in project development and/or operational support activities. analyzes industry and market technology trends to inform and drive the organization's strategy and goals. leads, supports, and informs overall architecture approach, guiding principles, and standards on cross-organization initiatives. offers insight and research on innovative solutions and technology strategy. defines conceptual and logical architecture specifications in line with the enterprise standards for a particular portfolio of work. understands and communicates strategic themes (e.g., differentiating business objectives that connect a portfolio to the strategy of the enterprise) and other key business drivers for architecture to solution and domain architects and other non-technical stakeholders. drives architectural initiatives and develops architectural frameworks to enable the development, operations, maintenance, and enhancement of technology. works across value streams and enablers (i.e., an organizational construct for an end-to-end process that delivers value to the organization and its customers, in which reside groups and teams which deliver products and capabilities) to harmonize architecture and ensure the appropriate flow of information and data. ensures architecture decisions are consistent across the enterprise and leverage opportunities for common approaches. leads related architects to ensure alignment across value streams. maintains high-level, holistic vision of enterprise solutions and development initiatives and related reference models. engages with business stakeholders to innovate and improve business capabilities and to design enterprise technology solutions on a strong, resilient, digitally decoupled, and scalable architectural foundation. manages relationships with leadership, solution and domain architects, and engineers to ensure enterprise architecture principles are understood for broad adoption. operates with an agile mindset, modeling agility in leadership to encourage iterative delivery with a focus on business value. provides an expert-level technical perspective during roadmap and quarterly planning to drive the alignment of epics (i.e., a significant solution development initiative within a portfolio) to the overall strategic direction of the technology organization. technical leadership – demonstrates strong technical expertise across multiple technology domains, including deep technical specialty in one or more of the following areas: applications – adms, aems, vi, ai/ml, gis, mobile…, application platforms, software engineering, enterprise information management, collaboration, integration and interoperability, systems management, endpoint devices, network, security, cloud advanced technology trends - demonstrates a strong understanding of emerging trends in the technology landscape, including new technologies, processes, and ways of working. able to determine the impact of technological advancement on the company's systems, applications, infrastructure, and practices. advanced enterprise architecture strategy - strong ability to translate business strategy into objectives for technology; capability to create a holistic enterprise architecture (application, data, and technical) that enables capabilities aligned to business goals. advanced enterprise architecture - strong understanding of the end-to-end value chain of the organization, and ability to articulate the current grid landscape and how gridos builds the foundational platform to orchestrate the grid of the future knowledge and understanding of cloud platforms such as aws, azure, or google cloud. advanced communication for technical leadership - ability to communicate technical ideas and strategies effectively to non-technical audiences, including executive leadership, via multiple mediums (e.g., written communications, verbal communications, presentations, etc.) stakeholder management - ability to create and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders in order to drive outcomes and create alignment around a vision or course of action. business functional knowledge - knowledge and understanding of the business context, market and operational functions of the operating company, and the wider utilities industry. cross-functional collaboration - ability to participate in co-operative working relationships including knowledge sharing and partnership in achieving solutions within and across business or operational functions. intermediate required qualifications bachelor’s degree in computer science or “stem” majors (science, technology, engineering and math) or 10 years industry experience a solid background and understanding of electrical power systems and utility operations is required. experience providing thought leadership to an organization. must be willing to travel 35-50% desired: 10 years - progressive experience in software engineering, technology design, and/or it architecture across multiple products, systems, and/or platforms. must include experience in at least 2 it disciplines, such as solution design, enterprise applications, product lifecycle management (plm), middle-tier services, database management, storage, distributed computing, virtualization and/or application technology. experience delivering in devops environments, including experience with continuous integration / continuous delivery (ci/cd) pipelines and agile practices is preferred. additional information relocation assistance provided: no #li-remote - this is a remote position

drawings, vendor data, calculations and other technical information submitted by a/e construction contractor for all phases of contract. provides requested technical information to a/e or construction contractor regarding interpretation of specifications, and other technical guidance as required. requests technical information or clarification of submitted data from a/e construction contractor as performance evaluation for the ae. provides technical support during pre-award stage including but not limited to bidders q&as, addendums, bid evaluation, release of final ifc drawings etc. provides post award support during construction. provides assistance to tss with design reviews as required. what required skills you'll bring: a degree in electrical/electronic engineering from a recognized university with a minimum of 15 years postgraduate professional experience and a minimum of 15 years of substations and power systems design experience. previous experience of working in the middle east and knowledge of saudi electrical regulations will be considered an advantage. registration in country of origin in an engineering professional association equivalent to us pe or uk chartered engineer status is essential. the ability to communicate effectively in spoken and written english is essential. must have sound overall experience in planning and designing systems for commercial, institutional, and industrial facilities. capable of reviewing designs carried out by a/es for high voltage, medium voltage (13.8 to 34.5kv) and low voltage power, indoor lighting, outdoor and road lighting, ground communication, and fire alarm systems. must have used etap or similar software to perform electrical studies. experienced in the preparation of bid documents. good knowledge of working in a bim environment would be an advantage. experience in designing (from conceptual to detailed) electrical systems for residential, commercial and institutional facilities is desirable in the following areas: medium and low voltage power systems one-line diagram and electrical rooms equipment layout. underground and exposed conduit and cable tray runs. calculations for demand load estimates, for sizing major equipment and circuits and selective protection coordination. lighting systems indoors and outdoors, calculations and physical layout. fire protection and communication systems one-line diagrams and physical layout of equipment and device. must have thorough knowledge of national electrical code, ieee, ansi, iesna, nfpa design experience (from conceptual to detailed) with utility and industrial facilities is desirable: medium voltage power distribution substation one-line diagram and equipment layout of major equipment. medium voltage switchgear. protective relaying schemes for medium voltage bus, transformer, cable and overhead line protection. station automation system, switchgear control, monitoring and metering. scada. what desired skills you'll bring: medium voltage power distribution layout with cables in duct banks and direct buried and corresponding ampacity calculations. thorough knowledge of ieee, ansi, and iec standards. provides technical support during pre-award stage including but not limited to bidders q&as, addendums, bid evaluation, the release of final ifc drawings etc. provides post award support during construction. provides assistance to tss with design reviews as required. minimum clearance required to start: not applicable/none parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. minority/female/disabled/protected veteran.

name: AECOM
title: Performance Analyst - Facilities Management
description: company description work with us. change the world. at aecom, we're delivering a better world. whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. we are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations. there has never been a better time to be at aecom. with accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. we invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of over 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. we're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. join us. job description monitoring key performance indicators (kpis) track and analyze the kpis for all the contract that the company is managing. collect, organize, and analyze data related to service providers performance to identify trends and areas for improvement. conduct regular reviews and evaluations of service provider performance to ensure compliance with contractual requirements. collaborate with project leads and other department to identify opportunities for improving efficiency and enhancing service delivery. work with operation teams to develop and implement performance improvement plans based on data analysis and results. ensure that the operations comply with regulatory requirements, industry standards, and organizational policies and procedures. offer recommendations to management based on data analysis and performance evaluations to support decision-making and continuous improvement initiatives. provide training and support to operation team on performance measurement methodologies, data collection techniques, and best practices for performance optimization. support the company and client in internal and external audits. create reports, dashboard, and presentations for senior management and client as appropriate. qualifications bachelor’s degree in facilities management, engineering, or a similar field. additional information experience required: 6-8 years of experience as a performance analyst, or similar. capable of professionally managing confidential information demonstrates the highest ethical standards when dealing with customers, contractors, and colleagues. excellent analytical skills, attention to detail, and ability to reconcile accounts accurately and timely. confidence and commitment to providing a high quality, professional service. excellent written and verbal communication. ability to work under pressure, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines. ability to prioritize tasks. ability to work well independently as well as the ability to work well with stakeholders. proficient in microsoft office. ability to provide backup support for other department’s staff. about aecom aecom is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. on projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. aecom is a fortune 500 firm and its professional services business had revenue of $14.4 billion in fiscal year 2023. see how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @aecom. freedom to grow in a world of opportunity you will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. whether you’re working from an aecom office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. you will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. aecom provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. we also provide a robust global well-being program. we’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too. join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. as an equal opportunity employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.

skills. behavioural competencies teamwork & accountability. ability to work with people from different nationalities. flexible in approaching, to improvise in dynamic situations. amicable personality to make long term relations with internal and external stake holders. self-starter and takes initiative for additional responsibilities and challenges. high level of integrity to comply with lucy procurement standards. does this sound interesting? we would love to hear from you. our application process in quick and easy. apply today!

name: Segula Technologies
title: Inspection Engineering RBI Lead
description: company description segula technologies italy is an engineering consulting company that deals with the design, development and production of the product. segula technologies collaborates with its customers developing ambitious projects both in house and in time & material within different business sectors, such as: automotive, aerospace & defense, rail, industrial automation, biomedical, energy and oil & gas. provides the best of international engineering, locally. why choose segula technologies? to become part of a constantly growing reality and with a projection towards the future! in segula technologies you will have the opportunity to work on different projects, within a company that is at the center of innovation and that has an internal staff of over 10.000 employees. what are you waiting for? join us. segula technologies gives space to your talent! job description we're looking for an inspection engineering rbi lead for our team operating in oil&gas field. the candidate should have at least 5+ years experience in risk based inspection engineering management. risk based inspection (rbi) is a powerful tool part of asset integrity management system (aims). rbi is focused on the identification of the major threats who causes loss of containment of pressurized equipment and on the mitigation of resulting risks managed through inspection. job focuses on development of an inspection plan that manages or controls the risk of loss containment, by combining both the probability of failure (pof) and the consequence of failure (cof). in this way, inspection-related activities are prioritized and inspection techniques specifically prescribed. the rbi lead is required to take the responsibility of the following topic: understand risk: to ascertain the risk of operating a facility, process unit, system, or component, risk criteria: to establishing risk criteria to judge acceptability of risk, risk scoring: to rank the equipment by their criticality (risk), risk management: to plan inspection strategy (on-stream and off-stream) with the aim to reduce risk to an acceptable level, inspection plan input: to identify input for written scheme of examination preparation. rbi lead regularly reports to the lead inspection engineer the status of the activities, highlighting areas of concern. typical work activities starting from corrosion loop diagrams (clds), equipment and piping item risk profile coming from rbi analysis, it is required to perform as follows: gathering related design data from technical disciplines to build-up a comprehensive inspection asset register, corrosion loop diagrams preparation, inventory group drawings preparation, rbi import spreadsheet preparation, inspection plan development to meet local regulations and rbi analysis outcome, supporting the project lead inspection engineer in reviewing the project technical documentation in respect to the contractual requirements, preparation of required documentation to attend meetings with company, project team or vendors. deliverable to start from regulatory requirements, company standard requirements, overall and unit plot plans, process flow diagrams, process & instrument diagrams, material selection and corrosion control report, corrosion monitoring strategy, material selection diagrams, equipment list, technical data sheet, c&e diagrams, fluid list, line list. output deliverables inspection asset register, corrosion loop diagram, inventory group drawings, rbi analysis report, inspection plan & detailed inspection program. qualifications technical skills advanced knowledge of: risk based inspection (rbi) methodology and software (api certification will be considered as plus), ndt inspection methods for static pressurized equipment and piping (certification in ndt techniques will be considered as a plus), inspection planning. fully aware of oil & gas plant related design documentation and drawings, which may include: 3d model, plot plan, p&ids, pfds, line list, ga drawings, mechanical data sheets, vendor manuals, procedures, etc. basic knowledge of naviswork 3d model software will be considered as plus. advanced knowledge of material selection and corrosion discipline for oil & gas plants. expert of ms office package. ability to work with 3d software application, i.e., naviswork freedom and pdf editor, i.e., power pdf advanced. personal skills the candidate possesses interpersonal and communication skills. responsibility for achieving goals and the ability to develop solutions to deal with different scenarios that may occur is strongly required. in addition, the candidate should have an open mindset to change, continuous improvement and learning. finally, trustworthy behavior consistent with what is stated, the ability to model one's approach to different counterparts, and the ability to gather, understand, and share information complete the candidate's profile. additional information location: ksa, al khobar office - onshore city accommodation rotation: 90/15 working hours: 8x6 duration of the contract: 12 months (extendible) availability: starting form june 1st, 2024

name: JASARA PMC
title: Senior Engineer Structural Shell & Core
description: neom – the line programme will grow and evolve and become the largest capital project world-wide. the programme aims to challenge the “status-quo” with the intention of delivering a real meaningful change such that neom is referenced as world class and world leader in numerous areas. neom – the line is a combination of multi-modules with each module representing a complex multi-discipline element of the overall programme with both standard, unique, and bespoke scope aspects. marina modules represent a “showcase” window of the neom – the line programme, being the key development interests of the line and neom as a whole. the overall planning and organization of the marina modules is aligned with the key anchor assets planned for these modules. such assets include a soccer stadium, museum, and university and many other, among other key facilities. each of these assets and the surrounding program is strategically located with consideration for the programmatic and performance demands of the asset type. the delivery of the anchor assets have the end-to-end responsibility for schedule, cost, and quality from the pre-construction stage duties to handover to meet current and future commitments and to maximize opportunities. a senior construction engineer specializing in the constructability of shell & core construction focuses on the essential structural and foundational elements of a building, typically before the interior finishes and details are added. the role purpose in the context of shell & core construction involves overseeing and engineering the construction and the sequence of activities of the designated scope. with the senior construction managers, the senior construction engineer should lead and coordinate the engineering of the construction during the life of the project and define the logistics requirements for the assigned scope, including lifting equipment, transport, handling and storing. the role should evolve with the progress of the works from a pre-construction/planning role to duties and obligations focused on construction management, t&c and contract administration once contractor/s is/are onboard. the package(s) of scope will be designated by the delivery director, these could be both standard and bespoke packages within the anchor assets program of the marina modules with high levels complexity and value in a fast-track environment. key responsibilities: analyze the design of the assigned assets and review these for constructability. produce, with the support of the senior construction managers, optimized construction methods and sequences for the assigned scope. get from the design information the necessary data to produce the construction methods, sequences and plans, engineering the construction methods. adopt sensible and reasonable assumptions when the full information is not available evaluating and recording the corresponding risks. extract from the construction methods the requirements to be exported to the design to assure the optimum constructability of the works. participate actively in the design meetings and workshops to get a deep and efficient level of coordination aiming an optimized design for construction without compromising the design intents and objectives. actively contribute to the identification, assessment and validation of the risks affecting the works within the scope. proposing adequate actions and mitigations reducing the neom risk exposure, in coordination with the risk management team, using risk management techniques, whilst enabling greater value to grow, improve and mature. calculate, in coordination with the planning team, the resources required to implement the corresponding construction methods and complete the works in the defined timeframes. anticipate and plan the resources needed for the construction management during the pre-construction and construction phases. lead and coordinate the engineering of the construction during the life of the project. ensure that the temporary works adhere to the requirements and regulations. define inspection and testing protocols for the construction equipment and temporary works to verify compliance with industry standards. contribute to cost estimation for shell & core construction activities and monitor expenses to stay within budget. identify cost-effective solutions without compromising structural integrity or safety. establish contingency plans to address unforeseen challenges or changes in project requirements. coordinate with his/her equivalents in other work packages for the prompt identification and optimized resolution of the interfaces between the works. contribute actively to the definition and implementation of the safety measures to safeguard the well-being of construction personnel and ensure compliance with safety regulations, working together with the safety, logistics, construction and lifting teams. contribute to the production of the necessary management plans and reports, including delivery, construction, qa/qc and safety. participate in the continuous improvement action plans including lessons learned and sharing any return of experience with other parts of the neom organization. mentor and accelerate the learning curve of the junior members of the team. requirements knowledge: advanced knowledge of construction management and technics of construction. good knowledge of planning, project controls, safety management and risk management. advanced knowledge on construction equipment and temporary works, including formworks, material transport and handling and lifting. good understanding of fast-track principles and process. basic knowledge in cost estimations. excellent knowledge and common-sense on all the activities on construction sites. skills: strong coordination backbone with collaborative management style and people management mindset. anticipation and proactive attitude. mid-term strategic thinking. good understanding of the construction constraints and priorities during the construction activities. capable of working within a multi discipline team, across multiple interfaces and complex stakeholders. open mind for modern methods of construction, new materials and innovation. able to handle all the various problems, issues, changes and emergencies that may arise within construction sites. ability to produce drawings, reports, calculations, specifications related with construction works. ability to operate in fast paced, pressured and changing environments, whilst being able to maintain clear decision making. ability to filter the information that is relevant and escalate it when necessary. ability to read and correctly interpret technical drawings, schematics, method of statements, inspections and test procedures, quality plans, and other construction related documentation. ability to use the usual software in the industry: windows, office, cad. anticipation and proactive attitude. mid-term strategic thinking focused. team-working mindset. experience: 15+ years of professional experience. used to work in complex matrix environments. experience in mega/giga projects in international environment and in middle east, in design&build or construction contracts at project/construction management level. experience in high rise and/or iconic high-end buildings would be valued. multidisciplinary architectural and engineering mind will be considered a plus. robust structural knowledge will be considered a plus. qualifications: a chartered civil or structural engineer or architectural degree is a must. project management accreditation is a plus.

name: Marn
title: Senior iOS Engineer
description: about marn: marn is a technology company established in 2017. it was acquired by jahez international group in 2023. the company develops point of sale (pos) software integrated with payment services to provide a one-stop solution for businesses in f&b, retail, entertainment, and services. marn grew massively in the past two years and continues to accelerate the growth of its customer base. here at marn, we aspire to become close friends working together towards disrupting the industry. we plan to accomplish our vision & mission via a strong desire to win, embrace mistakes, and make bold moves. we rely on radical candor in our learning to never repeat the same mistakes. we care personally, yet challenge directly. being part of marn, you should expect to make mistakes, be challenged while challenging others, and win big. job purpose: we are looking for a senior ios engineer to join our tech department at marn. as a senior ios engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining high-quality mobile applications for our ios platform. you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and test new features, as well as enhance existing functionalities. key responsibilities: design and build advanced applications for the ios platform in swiftui and uikit. collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications. identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs. help maintain code quality, organization, and automation. if you are passionate about ios development, have a strong understanding of swift and objective-c, and enjoy working in a collaborative environment, we would love to hear from you. join us at marn and be part of a dynamic team that is dedicated to creating innovative solutions for our users. qualifications: minimum of 5 years of experience in ios app development. proficiency in swift and objective-c programming languages. strong understanding of ios design principles and interface guidelines. experience with restful apis and third-party libraries. ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. experience with performance and memory tuning tools. knowledge of continuous integration and deployment. experience in realtime syncing technologies (signal r, firebase realtime db, pusher, rabbitmq, webrtc, and mqtt). experience in multipeer and implementing bluetooth integrations. experience in core data. compensation and benefits: competitive monthly salary. good health insurance. 21 working-days annual vacation.

name: Skillsearch Limited
title: Lead Engine Programmer
description: skillsearch is helping a games studio find a lead engine programmer with expertise in aaa console development to join their team in riyadh. this is a full-time role that comes with a generous salary and many compelling benefits. as a lead engine programmer, you will play a key role in developing and maintaining the studio’s cutting-edge game engine. you will work closely with the engineering team to design, implement and optimise core engine systems, tools, and features that power aaa titles. in your first few weeks in this role, you can expect to: collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify project requirements and develop solutions that meet the needs of the games and studio partners design, implement, test and debug engine components, including rendering, physics, animation, audio, input and scripting optimise engine performance, memory usage and resource utilisation to ensure smooth gameplay and minimise frame drops or other technical issues develop and maintain build scripts, automated testing frameworks, and continuous integration pipelines to support rapid development and deployment. to apply for this engine programmer role, you will need a degree in computer science, software engineering or a related field, plus at least five years of experience as an engineer in the video game industry, with a focus on game engines, tools, and infrastructure. you will also require the following: unreal and c++ programming skills expertise in object-oriented design, algorithms, data structures and software architecture familiarity with common game engine subsystems (rendering, physics, audio, etc.) and middleware such as unreal engine, unity or similar game engines experience with agile development methodologies and version control systems like git and bug. if you’re looking to impact and create change positively, you'll be rewarded with an excellent salary and benefits package for your inclusive and committed approach. please reach out to alfie from our team today at aab@skillsearch.com to apply for this full-time lead engine programmer position in riyadh. we'd love to help you get your next role and enable you to fulfil your professional ambitions. here at skillsearch, we're a recruitment company. in the simplest form, this means we place people at new companies - but it's so much more than that. for the past 30 years, we've been busy helping people (like you) with sought after skills find jobs in the games, interactive and enterprise systems industries all around the globe. our company comprises a team of dedicated consultants that work across various niche technologies, including games, virtual reality, ar and xr, workday, oracle, peoplesoft, and ecommerce. we are always exploring other cutting-edge markets. follow us to see a few of the jobs we're working on, find out which events you can see us at, and keep up with news in the technology, gaming and interactive world. welcome to skillsearch!

name: AECOM
title: Engineer - Mechanical
description: company description work with us. change the world. at aecom, we're delivering a better world. whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. we are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations. there has never been a better time to be at aecom. with accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. we invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. we're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. join us. job description performs specific and limited portions of a broader assignment of an experienced engineer. gathers and correlates basic engineering data using established and well-defined procedures. works on detailed or routine engineering assignments involving calculations and relatively simple tests. proposes approach to solve new problems encountered. identifies discrepancies in results. provides guidance to entry level engineers. performs work in accordance with agreed upon budget and schedule with moderate supervision. additional information about aecom aecom is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. on projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. aecom is a fortune 500 firm and its professional services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. see how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @aecom. freedom to grow in a world of opportunity you will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. whether you’re working from an aecom office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. you will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. aecom provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. we also provide a robust global well-being program. we’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too. join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. as an equal opportunity employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.

name: Smart Resourcing International (SRI)
title: Resource and Sustainable Supervisor
description: reputed client of smart resourcing international neom, saudi arabia one of our reputed client in saudi arabia resource and sustainable supervisor job description develop, implement and execute a routine management with reliable data collection, meetings, check and audits on site, indicators, analyses, root cause identification and action plan elaboration and execution; - identify and implement improvement opportunities, projects and best practices; - manage the communities resource & waste targets and objectives, aligned to the manager, director and manage the contracts related to resources and waste operation, transport, final treatment (recycling, landfill, waste to energy, hazardous, etc), suppliers, etc, verifying compliance with contract, analysing the contracts performance, applying the sla, identifying and implementing improvement opportunities to make them more sustainable, productive, efficient and safe. manage the necessary purchases related to the communities resource & waste management plan; - respect the legal requirements, the policies and the circular economy concept, focused in reducing the waste generation in the community, becoming zero waste to landfill, reducing the department expenses and increasing its incomes. 2) sustainability projects - identify, implement and manage sustainability projects in communities; - improve community sustainability indicators and achieve its targets; - give support to the sustainability champions; - manage the necessary purchases related to the sustainability projects lead by sustainability champions; - update reports and dashboards. knowledge, skills and experience - minimum 5 years of experience with waste management operation (waste generation, storage, transport, segregation, waste facility operation, final destination/ treatment, etc); - minimum 5 years of experience with resource & waste contracts management; - active profile for checks and audits on site; - ability to analyse procedures, processes, operation, identifying the root cause and solving problems; - management and operational skills; - ability to initiate and implement projects with teams; - focused on results; qualifications - tertiary qualification (degree or equivalent) in environmental engineer or similar course preferred other requirements experience level : minimum : 5 yrs maximum : 8 yrs area : qualification engineering diploma

name: Software AG
title: Account Executive (Super iPaaS)
Soft Skills: ['attention to detail', 'collaboration', 'collaborative', 'communication', 'communication skills', 'flexibility', 'innovation', 'organization', 'planning', 'responsibility', 'sense of urgency', 'teamwork', 'written communication']
description: we help you create effortlessly connected experiences for your customers, employees, and partners with an enterprise-grade ipaas that integrates anything, anywhere, any way you want. by bringing application, data, api and b2b integration together in the same generative ai-enabled platform, you can run a high-performing enterprise and constantly improve it based on data. get end-to-end visibility and governance across geographies, it environments, and complex business ecosystems, with hybrid multi-cloud connectivity, and enterprise-grade security relied on by the most powerful banks, governments, and corporations in the world. trusted by the world’s best brands for more than 50 years, our technology and team of integration enthusiasts will make sure that integration is a driver of innovation for your enterprise. we are big enough to compete and small enough to care. be you, join us. we are currently seeking an account executive to manage customer relationships and sell software ag’s webmethods and streamsets portfolio using its super ipaas framework. this person will act as a strategic advisor for their customers and use consultative and value-based selling techniques to develop and maintain relationships with c-level people within their account. you will effectively coordinate activities in your account by engaging with other software ag sales specialists, sales engineers, inside sales, sales development reps and consultants to successfully generate qualified opportunities, win new business, and build a long-term strategic partnership with your customer. essential functions understanding and effectively communicating the webmethods and streamsets value proposition to potential customers. achieve/exceed quarterly and yearly revenue targets using approved sag business planning, account management, opportunity management, and monitoring processes tools. drive and penetrate new accounts and meet with stakeholders (c level) within accounts selling collaboration solutions. meet with cios, it executives, lob executives, program managers, and other important partners. accurately forecast and report on opportunities within the assigned territory track all customer details including use case, purchase time frames, next steps, and forecasting. close net new logos and expand existing accounts. identify and close quick, small wins while managing longer, complex sales cycles. prospect, qualify, and develop a robust sales pipeline. conduct discovery and carry out on the sales process to uncover the needs of large, enterprise companies. develop a strategic plan for your territory to meet monthly, quarterly, and annual bookings and revenue objectives. timely and accurate updating of salesforce.com crm, forecasts, and pipeline data to ensure the generation of accurate territory and management reports. work with our partner team and partners directly to identify and work on opportunities. minimum requirements 6+ years of experience selling with middleware technologies, cloud architecture, integration platforms. prior experience selling software-based solutions, specifically into targeted new name accounts with deal sizes that range from $50k - $1m. field sales experience within big data, cloud, or saas sales. demonstrable success in meeting and exceeding a assigned quotas. growth mindset and embrace new ideas, ways of working and technologies. excellent prospecting skills using multiple tools and methods to effectively prospect across many accounts. invests in a customer-centric approach and willing to go out of their way to meet the customer at the place best for them. ability to understand customers’ business, needs, challenges and expectations. must have excellent verbal and written communication skills. work closely with business process owners across various functions to guide discussion and scope and draft functional and technical requirements. excel in both personal drive and collaborative teamwork organizational requirements and attention to detail are important, and the aptitude to prioritize in a high growth environment. good comprehension of sales performance metrics and must be driven with an extreme sense of urgency to deliver. a self-starter, self-governing, team-oriented and has a structured way of working. can develop and grasp convoluted business processes/business models and embodies a consultative approach. what’s in it for you? earn competitive total compensation and receive comprehensive country-specific medical and other benefits. enjoy time and location flexibility with our hybrid working model, which allows a remote workshare of up to 60%. work anywhere in your country or abroad for up to 10 days per year. set yourself up for success in your new role by upgrading your home office space using your one-time hybrid work payment. lean on the employee assistance program for support during some of life’s most common but difficult challenges. at software ag we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect and fairness where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. we believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, compensate, develop, promote, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. to all recruitment agencies: software ag does not entertain unsolicited cvs without prior approval from software ag's talent acquisition team. kindly refrain from sending cvs to our job’s alias, software ag employees, or any other organizational location without explicit consent. software ag assumes no responsibility for any fees associated with unsolicited cvs. #li-al1
