name: Avanceon MEA
title: SCADA Engineer
description: about avanceon: avanceon is a leading industrial automation company specializing in automating plants and infrastructure projects across various industries. we are dedicated to providing innovative automation solutions using plc and scada systems to enhance efficiency, safety, and productivity. job description: avanceon is looking for a talented and motivated scada engineer to join our team. as a scada engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and implementing supervisory control and data acquisition (scada) systems to support our clients in optimizing their industrial processes and infrastructure projects. responsibilities: scada system design: collaborate with project teams to design scada systems tailored to the specific requirements of clients' automation projects. plc integration: integrate scada systems with programmable logic controllers (plcs) to ensure seamless communication and control of industrial processes. hmi development: create human machine interface (hmi) applications that provide intuitive and user-friendly access to real-time data and controls for operators. data collection and analysis: develop data acquisition strategies to collect, store, and analyze data from various sensors and devices within industrial processes. system configuration: configure scada software, alarms, and event handling to ensure optimal system performance and reliability. troubleshooting and support: identify and resolve scada system issues and provide technical support to clients during installation, commissioning, and maintenance. communication protocols: implement and configure communication protocols, including modbus tcp, snmp, web services (restful, soap), and others, to facilitate data exchange and interoperability between different devices and systems. security and compliance: implement security measures to protect scada systems from cyber threats and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations. documentation: maintain detailed documentation of scada system designs, configurations, and project-related information. testing and validation: conduct thorough testing and validation of scada systems to guarantee functionality and performance. training: provide training and guidance to operators and maintenance staff on how to effectively use and maintain scada systems. requirements: bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, computer engineering, or a related field. proven experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining scada systems. proficiency in scada software platforms (e.g., wonderware, omi, wincc). strong knowledge of industrial automation technologies, plcs, and hmi development. understanding of cybersecurity principles related to scada systems. excellent problem-solving and communication skills. ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. willingness to travel to project sites as needed. if you are a dedicated and skilled scada engineer looking to make a significant impact in the field of industrial automation, we encourage you to apply and join our dynamic team at avanceon.

name: AvidBeam
title: Application Deployment Engineer – KSA
description: job brief: as an application deployment engineer, you will play a crucial role in delivering the ongoing/new project to ensure of a successful delivery of our products and solutions for avidbeam end-users in ksa. qualifications: saudi arabia residency, local transferable iqama is a must. must have a valid saudi driving license. flexibility to regular site visits in ksa is essential. b.sc. degree or equivalent, preferably in engineering/computer science or related fields. proven work experience as an application engineer not less than 2 years in a saudi software company or a related field. your responsibilities will include: build strong relationships with existing customers and provide ongoing technical support. address customer inquiries, resolve technical issues, and ensure customer satisfaction. identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling of our products and services. deploy and configure the software for new projects. conduct pocs and demos to ensure the system functionalities to potential clients. provide technical training to partners and clients. provide technical support to the clients (remote – onsite). gathering clients’ requirements to fulfill their needs. act as a technical expert and work closely with the clients to identify new business opportunities. prepare and deliver technical presentations, proposals, and demonstrations to potential clients. assist in the negotiation and closing of sales deals. support the partners to design optimal solutions for new projects. estimate h/w specs and storage calculation according to projects’ scopes. create and deliver presentations and demos to current/potential clients, to clearly communicate the solution design description, statement of work, product data sheets. effectively communicate client needs to the r&amp;d teams for future product enhancements. demonstrated ability to learn and apply new technologies very quickly with minimal assistance. good knowledge with ip network, including proven experience in designing, configuring, and troubleshooting ip networks. proficient with protocols such as tcp/ip, dns, dhcp, vlans, and routing protocols. ability to creatively explain and present complex concepts in an easy-to-understand manner. solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development. excellent written and verbal communication skills. excellent presentation skills. analytical and multitasking skills. experience in client-facing or customer engagement. advanced knowledge and hands-on experience in linux system administration, including but not limited to distributions such as ubuntu demonstrate the ability to install, configure, and maintain linux servers, ensuring optimal performance, security, and reliability is a plus. familiarity with containerization technologies such as docker and orchestration tools like kubernetes is a plus. strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex technical issues and provide effective solutions. demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of video surveillance technologies, including closed-circuit television (cctv) systems and their components. interested candidates are required to send their most updated cv supported with a cover letter to careers@avidbeam.com

name: BAE Systems
title: Aero-Science Instructor (Academic)
description: job title: aero-science instructor (academic) salary: competitive location: riyadh job purpose bae systems is the uk government’s nominated prime contractor under the government-to-government arrangements that are in place to provide equipment, support and training to saudi arabia. we provide maintenance of royal saudi air force aircraft and train rsaf personnel safely in a training environment in how to use their aircraft, equipment and weapons. bae systems saudi arabia is committed to supporting the saudi arabian national agenda including saudisation and the training and development of saudi national capability through the growth of the saudi national partner companies thereby reinforcing industrialisation and partnerships. the job holder is directly responsible to the academic manager scientific studies and his management team. he is a key member of the o&at training delivery team at the king faisal air academy (kfaa) and is primarily responsible for: the ongoing design and development of a number of relevant aeronautical science subjects’ courseware. instructing officer cadets in a number of relevant aeronautical science subjects. the maintenance of officer cadet discipline within the classroom environment. the assessment of officer cadets during the scientific studies phase. the recording and reporting of any issues that affect training delivery. job accountabilities instruct the job holder will be expected to: instruct in relevant subject areas according to the approved syllabus. deliver or supervise demonstrations in relevant subject areas. conduct visits to relevant areas of interest. assess the job holder will be expected to: conduct regular assessments to ensure cadets are progressing academically. conduct phase-end examinations to ensure training objectives have been achieved. discipline the job holder will be expected to: adopt and promote independent learning and a military ethos in line with the training environment. provide on-going evaluation of cadets’ discipline as part of their final assessment. counsel and motivate cadets, where applicable, on relevant academic and discipline issues. record the job holder will be expected to: record cadets’ academic assessment results. record cadets’ lesson attendance. record any discipline issues with cadets. use the training management system to ensure that all records are accurate, up-to-date, orderly and easily accessible. report the job holder will be expected to: provide regular reports concerning cadets’ academic progress, lesson attendance and discipline. report any other relevant issues whenever required or deemed appropriate. develop the job holder will be expected to: regularly review courseware for relevant subject areas as part of the sat. recommend and implement changes to relevant courseware. regularly review assessments for relevant subject areas as part of the sat. recommend and implement changes to assessments in relevant subject areas. apply company procedures for configuration control of curriculum and courseware, including preparing documentation and supporting data for curriculum or courseware change requests. recommend the acquisition or purchase of relevant courseware or equipment. integrate new courseware or equipment into the relevant course. ensure all training equipment is properly maintained and stored. contribute to preparation of timetables, scheduling and allocation of instructors. other duties the job holder will be expected to: ensure compliance with she policy and processes and duty of care responsibilities. undertake all mandatory and developmental training as required by the company. adhere to acceptable standards of behaviour, dress and performance as defined in company policy. provide feedback to management to improve service performance and responsiveness and identify opportunities. perform additional tasks as requested by line management that can be construed as a reasonable activity for a professional teacher / instructor. recruitment specification the job holder is to have a tertiary college, university or military academy background have specialist knowledge in at least one of the following areas: aerodynamics. aircraft and flight performance. aircraft engines. avionics. meteorology. experience in the design and development of courseware and training materials. fluency in english preferably to ielts 7 level (if non-native speaker). it literate with knowledge and experience of microsoft office. able to work independently and as part of a team. able to prioritise and meet deadlines. in addition, the job holder is to have: an academic background with: relevant master’s degree (preferably an msc), or equivalent. completion of a one-year post-graduate teaching course, an instructional technique (it) course or equivalent. relevant instructional and teaching experience within five years prior to appointment. or an ex-military background with: minimum of 1500 flight hours. completion of either a one year post graduate teaching course, a ground instructional technique (it) course or a comparable course, for example qualified flying instructor (qfi), qualified navigation instructor (qni), qualified weapons instructor (qwi). experience as a qfi, qni, qwi in an operational conversion unit or squadron. expatriate employee benefits in return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary, rent free accommodation and access to free recreation facilities, all available within company secured accommodation. in addition, a generous leave and travel allowance makes this an opportunity not to be missed. on successfully securing a role your appointment to saudi arabia will initially be on single status. on commencement of employment in saudi arabia you will have the opportunity to apply to have your family join you in the future. a full health care scheme is provided within saudi arabia. saudi national employee benefits in return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary and benefits package, including a generous leave and travel allowance, a full health care scheme and access to subsidised recreational facilities bae systems at bae systems, we provide some of the world’s most advanced, technology-led defence, aerospace and security solutions and employ a skilled workforce of some 82,500 people in over 40 countries. working with customers and local partners, we develop, engineer, manufacture and support products and systems to deliver military capability, protect national security and people and keep critical information and infrastructure secure. all appointments in saudi arabia are subject to receipt of all necessary government and/or customer approvals.

name: KBR
title: Sr. Telecommunication Engineer (Saudi National)
description: title: sr. telecommunication engineer (saudi national) kbr-amcde is a leading engineering and project management services company in saudi arabia that provides feed, detailed design, procurement and project management services to the onshore and offshore oil and gas markets. due to the recent award of various prestigious project, we have exciting new opportunities for ksa national to join the team. at kbr-amcde you will be exposed to state-of-the-art technology, industry leading design and project management practice while delivering meaningful projects. exposure to successful experienced co-workers, industry best practices, advanced technology and challenging projects makes kbr-amcde the ideal company providing opportunities for career growth and development. job description: responsible for the design, specification and services related to communication systems, such as satellite, line of sight, fiber optic, phone, public address systems and the transmission of data from supervisory control and data acquisition system. under general supervision, performs all conventional aspects of the functional area subject matter. devises new approaches to problems encountered. plans, schedules, and conducts work requiring judgment in the independent evaluation, selection, and adaptation of engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria. performs work which involves conventional engineering practice but may include a variety of complex features such as conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials, and difficult coordination requirements. provides technical guidance to designers and less experienced engineers. job tasks, correctly performed, impact indirectly on cost containment, efficiency, profitability or operations. requirements: undergraduate degree in engineering minimum of 5 years of related experience saudi national

name: KBR
title: Materials Standardization Engineer - Electrical
description: title: materials standardization engineer - electrical materials standardization engineer will provide coordination for spare parts management mro inventory cataloguing, standardization and data enrichment understanding of material classes and attributes understanding of bill of materials (boms), able to identify materials required for boms for specific equipment types understanding of technical data required to catalouge materials for a range of materials types based on class and attributes within discpline area familiar with de-duplication, oem to ocm conversion, generlization and variery control update the materials master data in the sap inventory catalogue and ensure its reliability. create/codify new spares parts/items of various material types & mrp along with their inventory levels to search the materials master/records to retrieve the desired information. support in conducting data cleansing activities to ensure accuracy and update inventory catalogues. coordinate with scm (supply chain) department for day to day function. coordinate with warehouse/maint.dept for spare parts inspection & getting the part details coordinate with oem for collecting the required bill of material and other part details

name: KBR
title: Lead Piping Stress Engineer- (Static/Dynamic Analysis)
description: title: lead piping stress engineer- (static/dynamic analysis) kbr-amcde is looking for a lead piping stress engineer with solid backround in static/dynamic analysis. candidates should have a minimum of 15 years of experience in the same field. static analysis: identify different stress packages through review of p&ids / line designation tables. performs piping flexibility analysis for critical piping systems during preliminary design and detailed design phase of project. perform analysis for sustained, thermal and multiple operating cases, occasional (viz winds, seismic, relief, hammer etc.) perform pipe stress analysis for different equipment like steam turbine, compressors, centrifugal pumps, tanks, exchangers, heaters, columns, etc. provide pipe loading information to civil/structure resolve high pipe loads on equipment nozzles & high secondary stresses in piping. selection of spring hangers, snubbers, struts for pipe supports. locate and identify pipe supports on isometrics along with type of supports. evaluation of local stresses via code using wrc107/297 or fea. review and sign-off piping isometrics considering flexibility and supporting. prepare complete documentation of the stress analysis and support design. participates in reviewing and checking designs, drawings and data from suppliers. understands role played by other disciplines on the project. provides technical direction and assigns work to engineers, designers, and drafters who assist on specific assignments. dynamic analysis: performs aiv & fiv using energy institute guideline or other applicable engineering standards. have a good in-depth knowledge of performing modal analysis, harmonic analysis, time history analysis & response spectrum analysis modules in caesar ii. have a good in-depth knowledge of performing harmonic analysis in caesar ii for reciprocating compressors/pumps. have a good in-depth knowledge of piping fatigue analysis. have a broad knowledge in troubleshooting piping vibrations that occurs at site. be able to interpret site measurement with respect to vibration. perform root cause analysis for piping vibrations that occurs at site. be able to recommend possible mitigation, to eliminate if not minimize piping vibrations that occurs at site to acceptable level as per standard requirement. job knowledge: knowledge of design codes and standards applicable for pipe stress analysis design work. very good and in-depth knowledge of stress analysis software like caesar 2, it’s applicability and interpretation. knowledge of design codes and standards applicable for pipe support design work. very good and in-depth knowledge of support selection.

name: KBR
title: Corrosion Engineer (Saudi National)
description: title: corrosion engineer (saudi national) kbr-amcde is a leading engineering and project management services company in saudi arabia that provides feed, detailed design, procurement and project management services to the onshore and offshore oil and gas markets. due to the recent award of various prestigious project, we have exciting new opportunities for ksa national to join the team. at kbr-amcde you will be exposed to state-of-the-art technology, industry leading design and project management practice while delivering meaningful projects. exposure to successful experienced co-workers, industry best practices, advanced technology and challenging projects makes kbr-amcde the ideal company providing opportunities for career growth and development. skills/qualification engineering degree from a recognized university or college (materials / metallurgy / chemical / mechanical) (essential)- gpa ¾ or 4/5 minimum 4-5 years of experience in a role which has had a primary technical function of providing design engineering services in the oil and gas, petrochemical industries. good soft skills; primarily presentation skills, communication, and collaboration with the global offices. familiar with the use of saudi aramco and industrial standards such as api 510, 570, 571, 580, 581 and 653. preference carries working experience of both corrosion engineering/material selection and asset integrity assessment experienced with saudi arabian & middle eastern clients nace certification api-580 (rbi certification) job responsibilities responsible for producing the agreed corrosion and materials selection deliverables as per project requirement and schedule for different stages of project. participating in internal/client meetings, moreover, traveling to client offices/ sites when required. preparing need lists for the data and information required for materials selection, such as existing corrosion control documents and historical corrosion rate data. raising inquiries to client/ proponent for fluid compositions. performing corrosion rate calculations as per data available from process engineer, using ece 5.7 software. preparing corrosion risk assessment and material selection reports for process and utility piping and equipment for onshore facilities. initiating the single discipline and interdisciplinary checks/ review of corrosion and material selection deliverables. producing material selection diagrams, corrosion loop diagrams and performing corrosion risk assessments. identifying and recommending needs for direct and indirect corrosion monitoring for facilities and pipelines. recommending protective coatings both internal and external, generating coating and painting specification documents. reviewing vendor documents if/ when required as per the assigned mandate. ensuring quality of corrosion and materials deliverables as per client design specification and technical requirements. liaising with the project teams for activities related to corrosion management for both green and brownfield assignments. liaising with global offices and vendors for the corrosion and material critical items. going through project scope documents, identifying and raising clarifications on corrosion and materials selection items. working closely with project controls and delivery team to set and achieve project milestones. liaise with the global offices for support where needed but expected convergence with subject matter experts (smes) sites visits outside offices as & when required.

name: KBR
title: Engineering Data Analyst (Digital Twin)
description: title: engineering data analyst (digital twin) job descriptions: as part of the company’s digital strategy, an engineering data analyst is required to work to specify and manage data within digital twin projects. reporting to the senior manager, information management the successful candidate will have the following experience. an engineer with strong knowledge and experience in the management of engineering data proven experience in leading engineering data management within engineering design or epc projects. tagging philosophy, tag management and tag quality assurance. oversight and implementation of plant and tag class libraries. integration of data within engineering projects across all disciplines. advanced skills in data manipulation using microsoft excel and/or other software. knowledge of the following an advantage: cfihos. saudi aramco engineering standards. aveva aim, ism and engineering. smartplant suite of engineering design tools, including spf. sql. powerbi.

name: KBR
title: Lead Cyber Security Engineer (ICS)
description: title: lead cyber security engineer (ics) overall summary lead control systems engineer with proven experience in the design of industrial control systems (ics). premilitary responsibility to design cyber security procedures and controls for all automation systems and process plants. knowledge in the established cyber security controls for various domains of ot cyber security are implemented by all the automation groups. he shall continuously monitor the latest cyber solutions and keep them updated with the latest security updates and threat feeds. he shall continuously monitor the control system for potential cyber vulnerabilities and risk assessment and implement the vulnerability management program. actively take part in risk analysis of the implemented cyber controls on a regular basis and execute risk reduction strategies. required knowledge on saudi aramco cyber security and network related standards, process automation network (pan), industrial control systems (ics) and related cyber security concepts (policies, standards, and procedures related to ics cybersecurity supply chain management). minimum 15 years’ experience in oil & gas, hydrocarbons, and/or infrastructure industries. excellent communication and presentation skills needed. duties and responsibilities: a highly qualified control systems engineer who manages design, engineering, procurement, integration, and testing of the ics systems (dcs, esd, rmps, ccs, pan, dahs, etc.), which collectively form an integrated process control system, needed for automation projects. responsible for design, specification, sizing and equipment needed for control and monitoring of process units and utilities (bpcs, safety systems, sis, sil, analyzers, pcs communication, field instrumentation, valves, advanced controls systems, etc.) lead site evaluation (site survey) teams for revamp and brown-field projects as needed. required knowledge on international standards like ieee 802.3, iec62443-3-3, iec 62443-1-1 develop/check basis of design documents. scoping of projects, including control systems deliverables develop/check work plans for control systems team. develop/check control systems deliverables, validate the vendor nmr documents and vendor proposed design that complying the latest sa and international standards. estimate work hours. provide technical leadership and guidance to the project team, including the clients. responsible for design integrity of control systems engineering scope, performance of assigned staff, and on-schedule delivery of the work within budget. lead technical presentations to clients and their representatives as needed. serve as technical resource to control systems engineers and related discipline engineers and designers. provide technical leadership to ensure that applicable procedures and standards (client, kbr and international) are correctly applied. key interactions: project management discipline managers vendors (technical) client qualifications & years of experience: minimum bachelor of science in control systems or related field, and a minimum of 15 years of relevant engineering experience especially in control systems design, process control networks and cyber security requirements for ics design. key skills & technical competencies: sound knowledge of basic engineering principles, control systems and instrumentation technology, networking, and safety devices for process automation networks. familiarity with key international, sa engineering standards and procedures is desirable. direct and relevant experience in oil/gas / petrochemical plants / fertilizer plants / with oems. working knowledge with various automation systems (honeywell, triconex, siemens, abb, allen bradley, ge mark vi & vie). required knowledge on configuration of layer 2 & 3 switches, firewall, and layers related to process automation network (pans). required knowledge on configuration procedure for ics nodes and servers like nms (network management system), ntp (network time protocol), opc, dc (domain controller), anti-virus, alms (alarm management system), windows patch management, dahs (data acquisition and historization system), dmz (demilitarized zone), and pi servers. proven successful experience in industrial automation security domain. certification in network management (like ccna) and cyber security (like ics/scada cybersecurity, global industrial cybersecurity professional (gicsp), certified scada security architect (cssa), certified information systems security professional (cissp) certification) is preferred. ability to handle responsibility and complete projects within schedule. sound knowledge for development of ics scope of work and services needed from ics vendors. must have experience in finalization of ics tbe and finalization of ics contract agreement. must be proficient in english, oral and written. excellent technical presentation skills needed.

name: KBR
title: Cathodic Protection Designer - Certified AMPP level-2 Cathodic protection Technician
description: title: cathodic protection designer - certified ampp level-2 cathodic protection technician kbr, saudi is looking for 10+ well experienced cp designer (cp drawing expert) with saudi aramco project experience in cathodic protection for oil & gas onshore, offshore and petrochemical projects (experience in epc and cp design consultancy companies). duties and responsibilities; to prepare microstation design drawings for tanks, vessels, well casing, pipelines, and plant piping cp system. having in depth knowledge of microstation operations capable to generate new drawings as per cp design requirements. capable to update design package as per go by given. should be able to prepare drawings based on calculation sheets provided by engineer. perform cp site survey to collect inputs require to complete design and drawings. to collect site data as required for cathodic protection design of well casing, ac mitigation and pipelines site visit report preparation and sketch marked with location etc. self-capable of handling task with decision making capability on site as required. flexible to support inter discipline task related to drawing preparation as required. having experience of working in saudi aramco project key interactions; discipline manager cp team lead qualifications; engineering degree or 3- years diploma or equivalent preferred: certified ampp level-2 cathodic protection technician key skills & technical competencies: must be proficient in english, oral and written communication. expert in microsoft office and other desktop software should have basic knowledge on cp design preparation. should have saudi driving license & driving experience.

name: KAUST
title: FACULTY POSITION IN BIO-DEVICES AND BIOINTERFACES FOR DIAGNOSTICS AND THERAPY
description: faculty position in bio-devices and biointerfaces for diagnostics and therapy king abdullah university of science and technology: faculty positions: biological and environmental science and engineering division (faculty) location king abdullah university of science and technology (kaust), thuwal, saudi arabia open date feb 07, 2024 description the bioengineering (bioe) program in the biological and environmental science and engineering (bese) division at king abdullah university of science and technology (kaust) bridges the university’s strengths in engineering, chemistry and biology. the bioe program seeks faculty candidates (at the rank of assistant professor, although compelling candidates will be considered at higher ranks) with multi-disciplinary expertise and activities in the domain of: bio-devices and biointerfaces for diagnostics and therapy topics of focus include (but are not limited to): point of care biosensing, wearable and implanted systems, digital-assisted tools, and platforms for measuring biomolecular or physiological parameters (e.g., smartphone-based diagnostics) novel microscale or nanoscale technologies for biomolecular analysis (e.g., paper-based droplet systems) nanopore transport digital/droplet, analytical and reactor microfluidics organs on a chip for diagnostics and drug discovery methodology (machine learning, deep learning, and ai) for the analysis, biomarker discovery, and predictive models based on digital health data we seek candidates with a ph.d. in relevant areas of engineering and an outstanding research record with publications in the top-tier journals of their respective fields. the successful candidate is expected to establish research activities that contribute to the bioe program’s research mission to integrate engineering tools and solutions for challenges and opportunities in biology. the candidate should have a strong commitment to excellence in teaching at the graduate level (master's and phd levels). the candidate will teach in the bioe curriculum and is expected to contribute to the current list of core courses and electives. the successful candidate is also expected to provide professional service at the program, division, and university levels. while rooted in bioengineering, the candidate is expected to engage with the other programs across divisions at kaust, such as electrical engineering and computer science, and materials science and engineering, to advance technologies for medicine and health. candidates are expected to have a plan for attracting funding and consider how to integrate their research activities into the kingdom’s economic growth strategy. the program welcomes applications from all qualified individuals. we strongly encourage applications from members of all underrepresented groups. the position will remain open until filled. about kaust kaust is an international, graduate research university dedicated to advancing science and technology through interdisciplinary research, education, and innovation. kaust attracts top international faculty, scientists, engineers and students to conduct curiosity-driven and goal-oriented research to address the world’s most pressing scientific and technological challenges. located in saudi arabia, on the eastern shores of the red sea, kaust provides an award-winning campus to live, work, study and play, and offers superb research facilities, with guaranteed baseline research funding, infrastructure support, entrepreneurship opportunities and internationally competitive salaries. for more information about kaust, please visit http://www.kaust.edu.sa. more information about the bese division and the bioe program is available at http://bese.kaust.edu.sa and https://bioe.kaust.edu.sa. application instructions interested candidates should upload the following materials: a cover letter introducing your candidacy and explicitly stating both the position and the rank. the rank must be consistent with the candidate’s experience up-to-date curriculum vitae, including a full publication list statement of research interests (5 pages maximum) statement of teaching interests (2 pages maximum), including teaching philosophy and an outline of 1-2 graduate planned graduate teaching course(s) names and contact information of 4 to 5 referees. referees should have positions in academic or industrial research laboratories. in the case of associate and full professor applications, the referees should be of a rank higher or equivalent to that of the proposed appointment copies of most relevant publications (maximum of five) application process this institution is using interfolio's faculty search to conduct this search. applicants to this position receive a free dossier account and can send all application materials, including confidential letters of recommendation, free of charge.

name: Parsons
title: Monitoring and Reporting Section Manager
description: job description: parsons is looking for an amazingly talented monitoring and reporting section managerto join our team! in this role you will get to oversee the monitoring and reporting activities for construction projects managed by the project management consultancy (pmc). this role requires a strategic thinker with a strong understanding of construction project management, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to communicate complex information clearly and effectively to diverse stakeholders. the monitoring and reporting section manager will collaborate closely with the project team, client, and external stakeholders to establish monitoring frameworks, track project performance, and provide valuable insights to optimize project outcomes and mitigate risks. what you’ll be doing develop and implement monitoring and reporting frameworks tailored to the specific requirements of the construction project managed by the pmc, ensuring alignment with project objectives, client expectations, and contractual agreements. collaborate with delivery directors, project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to define key performance indicators (kpis) and establish benchmarks for monitoring project progress, schedule adherence, budget performance, quality assurance, and risk management. design and maintain databases, dashboards, and other tracking tools to capture and organize project data, including schedules, budgets, procurement activities, resource allocations, and stakeholder communications. conduct regular assessments of project data to identify trends, deviations, and potential risks, and communicate findings to the project team, client, and senior management through comprehensive reports, presentations, and executive summaries. monitor compliance with project requirements, contractual agreements, and regulatory standards, and ensure that all monitoring and reporting activities adhere to relevant policies, procedures, and industry best practices. implement proactive measures to address issues identified through monitoring and reporting activities, working collaboratively with the project team to develop and implement corrective actions, mitigation strategies, and performance improvement initiatives. provide guidance and support to the project team on data collection methodologies, reporting tools, and best practices for monitoring and reporting, fostering a culture of accountability, transparency, and continuous improvement. stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory developments related to construction project management, monitoring, and reporting, and recommend innovative solutions to enhance project efficiency and effectiveness. participate in project meetings, workshops, and client presentations as required, and contribute to the overall success of construction projects managed by the pmc through active engagement and collaboration with the project team and stakeholders. represent the pmc in discussions with the client, contractors, regulatory agencies, and other external stakeholders regarding project monitoring and reporting requirements, performance metrics, and data analytics. what required skills you’ll bring bachelor's degree in engineering, construction management, project management, or a related field from an accredited top tier international university. minimum of 18 years of experience in project management, construction monitoring, reporting, or a related field, with a proven track record of success in delivering complex construction projects as part of a pmc or similar organization. expertise must have been gained from working for western internationally reputed firms. experience of working internationally. ksa or middle east experience preferred. in-depth knowledge of construction project management principles, methodologies, and best practices, with a strong understanding of project lifecycle phases, processes, and workflows. proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as microsoft excel and power bi. familiarity with project management software such as primavera p6 preferred. experience in dashboard reporting, monthly report preparation, validation of input data and consolidation of reports from multiple projects. excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex project data, identify trends and patterns, and generate actionable insights to inform decision-making. strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders and communicate technical information in a clear and concise manner. demonstrated leadership abilities, with a track record of building and motivating high-performing teams and driving results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. commitment to upholding the highest standards of professionalism, integrity, and quality in all monitoring and reporting activities undertaken on behalf of the pmc minimum clearance required to start: not applicable/none parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. minority/female/disabled/protected veteran.
